text: Glen Ester Clark (March 10, 1940 – January 25, 2018) was a pinch hitter in Major League Baseball who played for the Atlanta Braves during the season. Listed at , 190 lb., Clark was a switch-hitter and threw right-handed. He was born in Austin, Texas. Clark was 26 years old when he entered the majors in 1967 with Atlanta, being limited to pinch-hitting duties. He appeared in four games and was hitless in four at-bats.
